result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda S. Morrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
6 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment/seeking work if defendant qualifies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

INCLUDES 16CF291, 15CF184, 15CF796, AND 17CM2058. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
State notes agreement of the parties. VRCW. 
COURT questions parties re: agreement. 
Atty Sawyer makes statement. Deft makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF291: Ct. 1>>1 yr MCJ with 254 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ with 254 days credit. 
In 15CF184: Ct. 1>>1 yr MCJ with 292 days credit. 
In 15CF796: Ct. 1>>1 yr MCJ with 257 days credit. 
In 17CM2058: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ with 202 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS jail sentences to be with huber for work/school/treatment/seeking work if def qualifies. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT ORDERS unpaid monetary obligations converted to civil judgment.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:03 am 
INCLUDES 16CF291, 16CF590, 15CF796, AND 15CF184. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Cana Laska. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF291 AND 16CF590.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 16CF590: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 16CF291: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty.  


MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ AND ENTER JUDGMENT IN 15CF796 AND 15CF184. 
State moves to enter judgment on Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater) in 15CF796 and on Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater) in 15CF184. 
COURT grants. 

SENTENCING IN ALL FILES. 
Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation in 15CF184 ONLY: $350 restitution to Marathon Savings Bank to be paid at a rate of at least $25 per month. 
COURT finds the def entitled to jail credit: In 16CF291>>2 days. 
                                                                     : In 15CF796>>6 days. 
                                                                     : In 15CF184>>41 days. 

Adj: 11:18 am

to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Count One & Count One
